Posts.Content: Love your sense of humour Beevergirl !! xx   Lynda xx    "Winston"
Posts.Title: Christmas presents did you really think this out

Posts.Content: Hi Carmen      It doesn't seem five minutes ago, although it is actually ten months, that I was in your shoes.  Taking a day at a time is a really good thing.  Having a strong husband is also a great blessing for you.  I have had two ops, chemotherapy and am half way through the rads, I can see the end of the tunnel, but I have met some great people, as in hospital staff, and even made friends with people who live local to me who have been on this sight.    It really has been an eye opener of a journey meeting so many people and how wonderful they have been.  Prior to having BC I hadn't been in a hospital since I was nine years old having my tonsils out so it was all so new.      You will be fine Carmen, take it easy, and take help from people who offer it, try and make the journey as easy as possible on yourself.  Lynda xxx  "Winston"
Posts.Title: Taking it one day at a time

Posts.Content: Hi Anne    I am visiting the oncology doctor at the hospital next Tuesday, then starting chemo shortly after, so your not alone !!  We will all have to share notes on this website !!   "winston"  xx
Posts.Title: Chemo starting next Tuesday

Posts.Content: Hi I had quite a wait seven weeks in total.   Had ANC on 9th August and didn't start first chemo until 2nd October.   I was anxious and worried.  I would have waited longer if it wasn't for the fact I went to my BC nurse and explained how worried I was, and she set the wheels in motion for me.     It is an anxious time.  Best Wishes    Winston xx
Posts.Title: Waiting!

Posts.Content: Hi Earls,  thats encouraging news about the Docetaxel.  I'm starting on the same regime as you very soon but I'm at the very beginning !!   Its good to know that they can reduce the drugs by 20 % if required, and that district nurses can administer injections for infections.  Real good.  And for us girls to hear you having little jokes is also good to hear !!  I'm playing a waiting game at the moment, just waiting, and waiting and waiting to get my letter to go to the hospital for my first FEC.       Husbands are just great arn't they.   My husband has really pulled the stops out since I've been diagnosed with th big 'C', what would we do without them ?! Love to you Earls, take a well earned rest today, after your eight hours yesterday !!! winston xxxxx
Posts.Title: 1ST DOCETAXEL YESTERDAY

Posts.Content: Thank you SaxxyD the things you have told me are really important, I will now make sure I get the physio afterwards.  I try very hard to keep as healthy as possible in this journey, eat healthily and exercise.  Have been doing exercises on a dvd "Getting fitter, feeling stronger" which oncology nurse gave me after first op.  I have written creams down as may look into them for myself.  eventually will be returning to work, so want to be as fit and healthy in the long run as I possible can.  I stayed in hospital one night after mastectomy, but was given the chance to stay longer but returned home.  I think this time I will stay longer if given the chance.  As much as I want to return earlier, husband has no choice but to work and I have three demanding terriers at home, although I do have some help.  Thank you again !  May PM if if thats ok ! winston x
Posts.Title: Just had telephone assessment/pre op check this morning

Posts.Content: Hi girls, just had pre op check via phone from my hospital.   Has anyone had a mastectomy followed by lymph node clearance in art pit, and any comparrisons to be made.  I realise that there will probably be a bit of discomfort with both but found with first one anyway anaesthetic took a while to wear off and gradually reducing pain relief helped.   Had mastectomy 27/6 going in for lymph node clearance 9/8.   winston x
Posts.Title: Just had telephone assessment/pre op check this morning

Posts.Content: Thanks for the advice Cassie really appreciate it,   I recovered quite quickly from the first op. and the last week feel a lot better.   Trying to get myself as fit as possible now for the next op.  When I had the mastectomy the last time I had had an op was having my tonsils out when I was nine years old.  Things have certainly moved on.   You can't beat hearing the experiences of others, who have been down the same road ! Thanks again ! winston x
Posts.Title: Just had telephone assessment/pre op check this morning

Posts.Content: Just updated my avatar pic to show off my dogs too jellytot !  They deserve the publicity and I'm so proud of them ! Winston
Posts.Title: I have just upset the dog

Posts.Content: I utterly adore my three terriers, and they have been so important in just being there when I needed them.    I know that even on bad days, I still have to think of them, feed them, walk them, give them treats and they at the end of the day in my eyes, far more important than me in the pecking order !! LOL !!!     I watch how they vie for my attention, push each other out the way to get the best cushion, and now when I just can't exercise them as much as I used to, .... they still love me unconditionally !!! I just loved your post, it was really refreshing to hear someone talk about their pets !!!! An ardent dog lover !!! Winston love and hugs XXXXXX
Posts.Title: I have just upset the dog

Posts.Content: Hi Nain    Got my bone scan tomorrow.  Went out and joined a cancer social club today, what a hoot !!  it sort of got me primed up for tomorrow.   I have a new resolution, when I met the woman who fitted my wig, she said go through your cancer journey, but try not to let it rule your life.   So, well for the time being I "tollerate it", it helped me going to this club today, where others with different cancers were there we had a good hearty laugh about really silly things really, and it was the most uplifted I had felt for ages !!!   I just can't be thinking about this damn cancer 24/7 !!!  Sorry about that winge on your thread Nain !!  I'm off to read a porno book, .....only joking !!   Take care, love and God Bless !! Ever emotional Winston XX :o))
Posts.Title: Bone and CT scans

Posts.Content: Hi ankah, you have come to a wonderful support system.  We are all in the same boat, we support each other, cry with each and laugh with each other, as we all appreciate what we are all going through.  You have come to the right place. !!!  A lot of us girls have had the op that you are going to have and can answer questions you may be worried about, so don't be frightened to ask because there will be someone who has been through the experience and can give you first hand knowledge. Winston xxx love and hugs to you !! :o))
Posts.Title: Newgirl

Posts.Content: Hi Annabel,  I have three terriers, Monty, Winston and Tasha, the two boys we had from young puppies and Tasha was a rescue we took on about nine months ago, when my husbandos cocker spaniel died suddenly. I couldn't image life without my pets, especially now.  They need a lot of attention and are sometimes quite naughty buy they are a great distraction, and like kids just have to have attention !  I have a Dandi Dinmont terrier, a Westie and Tasha is a Westie cross Shitzu. Have I spelt that right ?    Its very funny because they all stand at the same height and so can look each other in the eye, but my Dandi has little short legs and a very long body, and huge donkey eyes they are enormous !  He was taken to the pooch parlour recently for a good cut, and had the grumps with me for a good week afterwards.  He just sits and watches the other two play rings around him and he doesn't seem to care !!  I must stop now, or I will get really carried away !! winston x
Posts.Title: Bought a puppy :)

Posts.Content: Hi Annabel,  I have three terriers, Monty, Winston and Tasha, the two boys we had from young puppies and Tasha was a rescue we took on about nine months ago, when my husbandos cocker spaniel died suddenly. I couldn't image life without my pets, especially now.  They need a lot of attention and are sometimes quite naughty buy they are a great distraction, and like kids just have to have attention !  I have a Dandi Dinmont terrier, a Westie and Tasha is a Westie cross Shitzu. Have I spelt that right ?    Its very funny because they all stand at the same height and so can look each other in the eye, but my Dandi has little short legs and a very long body, and huge donkey eyes they are enormous !  He was taken to the pooch parlour recently for a good cut, and had the grumps with me for a good week afterwards.  He just sits and watches the other two play rings around him and he doesn't seem to care !!  I must stop now, or I will get really carried away !! winston x
Posts.Title: Bought a puppy :)

Posts.Content: Good Luck !! Winston XXX
Posts.Title: results after mx

Posts.Content: Hi Mandi,     I'm inbetween FEC 2 and 3 at the moment, and I find that the first 6/7 days after chemo taking anti-sickness meds, and I have a course of injections I have to take to boost the bone marrow in producing the old white blood cells.  But things do get better.    I had two weeks after first chemo in relatively good health, then they zapped me again and I took anti-sickness meds and am pulling myself out of it now.   I have found this session I have felt more tired, and my body has felt the effects of achy bones and muscles, didn't think I would get this until I started the Docetaxel, but there you go !! I agree with Catherine I have deffinately had moments where I have wondered around like aimless sheep, drifting about, not being able to settle except to find my ever faithful kettle where I can make myself a strong cup of tea !!   My tea and ginger biscuits have been a comfort, and when hubby comes in from work, he usually brings me in a selection of cream cakes or sweets !!  They are a comfort !!  Perhaps think of something you really like, and gets loads of them brought it, spoil yourself !!  I watched tv yesterday and they asked Kylie Minogue who had breast cancer a couple of years ago and who had chemo as well how she coped, and one thing that stood out for me was "be kind to yourself, and be a bit selfish in taking care of yourself, even if it isn't in your nature to do so." It does get better !!  Take each day at a time, if you have a bad day, you could wake up the next morning and feel totally different.  Sometimes I feel a bit low, but then the next day I wake up in the morning look out at the birds, and nature taking place and it is very refreshing !!  Everyday is different.  Hope this helps !!   Take Care !! Lynda xx  "Winston"
Posts.Title: 1st fec

Posts.Content: Bless you Rebecca !    I've got all this to come, taking note of everyone's comments, in case I'll need them meself !  Good on ya !!  Atta girl !!! My thoughts are with you. ! winston x
Posts.Title: Hooray...and up she rises!

Posts.Content: Hi Angie      Well you have certainly come to the right place.   You will find, words of reassurance, comfort and when you are having some ups and downs there will be someone if not a handful of ladies who can share there experiences with you.     I also have had a mastectomy, lymph node clearance and am half way through my chemo sessions, and at the moment when tiredness rears its head it is such a comfort for me to come on this sight, there is such a great camaraderie on here, and I personally can't think highly enough of it !! Some of ladies are so knowledgeable about procedures, and the biological ins and outs of breast cancer which is so good. Yes, this big 'C' journey is a long old battle, but you will find you will bond with some of the girls, and if you accept 'friends' and put request out for 'friends', you can then private message some of the girls and get to know them quite well, and they will be in touch with you regularly !!   Such a comfort !!  This isn't an easy journey, won't pretend it is, I have had ups and downs along the way, and things will challenge you sometimes, and you will have to pull out all the stops to cope with it, but just get on here and tell us all about it, and you will get support.     Lovely to have you on board !!! Lynda xxxx  "love and hugs"  :o)))   "Winston"
Posts.Title: newbiee

Posts.Content: Hi Jellytot,  everyone have said such a lot already, and I guess I would just like to add that it is such a rock road we tread with its ups and downs.  And yes, sometimes as Annie said perhaps go out with hubby and have a good evening out and treat yourselves, and try to forget this nasty black whole which we sometimes find ourselves in.      My BC nurse is so good, pehaps  there is someone like that who you can talk you.  We are all behind you !! Take care Jellytot !! Winston xx   "Bigs hugs from me " !!
Posts.Title: Feeling Low

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for the replies everyone,  it really helped !!   I do tend to be a sensitive old soul when it comes to side effects of drugs.    So don't worry 'poemsgalore' you will probably sail through it !!!!   Winston xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Side effects with Anastrozole (Armidex)

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, after having ops, chemo and rads, I have now been put on hormone therapy for five years, which seems ok, I have only been on the treatment for three days, but seem to be experiencing a bit of dizziness, and lightheadedness which generally disappears later on in the day.  Just wondered how other folk have got on with this hormone therapy ? Love to all (I was from the school of 2012) - keep moving forward girls !! Winston :0))  xxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Side effects with Anastrozole (Armidex)

Posts.Content: Hi Kitticat   Just want to say was so full of emotion when I read your message.  So good to hear it.  Us girls on the start of our chemo journey just love to hear inspirational words like that !!   And you've made it !!!!!!!   What a brave and courageous lady !!!!! Love and hugs Winston xxxx  ;o))
Posts.Title: Chemo ends - Where's the wine and the tissues?!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Annie     Yes it sounds like you have a great oncologist, and I bet it will help that you are going back to work soon, a healthy distraction.  Sometimes these little niggles in our minds can keep us awake at night, and drive us potty, and then the reality isn't that bad after all.    I've gone potty gardening, don't know what I'm going to do in the winter, buy a gaberdine mac and psychodelic wellies I suppose !  I just find its a distraction from everything that is going on around me.   Like Luvviie said this is a long term journey we're on, and its finding things which can take our mind off it if only for a couple of hours.  I'm no one to shout as I do get stressed sometimes and let out on this website, which for me is an absolute Godsend !!        Don't worry Annie we are all here supporting you, we understand exactly what you are going through !!!   Winston xx :o))
Posts.Title: Onc appointment today, reality kicking in :(

Posts.Content: Hi ladies,   Can anyone help me with any suggestions of suitable drugs to help with stress after cancer treatment ?  I am currently in the process of coping with a property that is taking a while to sell, and I'm also changing jobs.  My GP has given me Diazapam which didn't agree with me.   Has anyone had good experiences with these drugs ? Winston xxx   Havent been on here for a while !!
Posts.Title: Can anyone help me with suggestions for medication helping with stress...

Posts.Content: Hi Dorothee, all the advice sounds real good, thanks for that !!!!   Winston xxxx   Hope you enjoyed all your travelling !!
Posts.Title: Can anyone help me with suggestions for medication helping with stress...

Posts.Content: Take care, you are in the right place, like londongurl says there are many here who are further on in their treatment and who can give good advice.   I can remember when I first heard from my surgeon that I had breast cancer, I was in shock for quite some time.  Eventually things began to sink in and then when treatment started I sort of had a sense that things were moving forward, even though they were slow, they were moving forward.    Hope this helps.   winston xx
Posts.Title: Different day, different diagnosis. Now it is HER2+

Posts.Content: Thank you Sasha Rose, for your lovely comments.  Sorry I didn't see them earlier.  They really were comforting words,  I WILL MISS YOU !!!!  Do you have to go ?  I personally feel that you have an aweful lot to give......   Feelings are a strange thing arn't they ?  Some of us find it easy to show them than others.  I personally find it difficult to lose my rag,  I wasn't sure what response I would get on the site, but the big 'C' pushed me just a bit too far !!      When I was first diagnosed with the big 'C', I wanted to show to people that I was coping, getting over the ops quickly, that I was ok.    Now realising, that this thing isn't going to be over next week, but will be around atleast another six months, that I have to knuckle down and accept that its going to be a long ride.  With humps and bumps on the way.   I thought I was in control a bit but it proves the big 'C', does take over your complete life.  Thank you for everything you have said Sasha Rose, and please come back from time to time !!!  Winston X(Lynda)x Mandi, you won't believe what I did just after I had my mastectomy, mind this was back in June, there was a really hot day, and thank goodness we have a private garden, I just wanted to prove a point that I was still proud of my body, so I went TOPLESS !!   lol !!!  (I timed 3 1/2 minutes, then the top went back on.    LOL !!!! It was very liberating, I hadn't done that in thirty years with two boobs!! LOL !! Winston xxx ;o)))
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Thank you so much my dear friend Beevergirl !! and to you to Abbey !!, Do you know I am such an inhibited person normally, it takes a lot for me to lose my rag like that, it rarely happens, probably never do it again.   I feel so much better now, and your words of advice and comfort have made me feel so much better !!!   I suppose I felt I was losing control of the situation and it was swamping me a bit.    Thanks Beevergirl for saying that you had felt like that before, now I don't feel alone, and Abbey what a great bit of reverse psychology to buy the wig before you need it, yeah I think I'll do that !!! Feeling a lot better, now I just hope I don't get told off by Precilla in the mac office for ranting too much ! LOL !!! Winston xxx  Love and hugs to you both !!! ;o))
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

It was very liberating, I hadn't done that in thirty years with two boobs!! LOL !! Winston xxx ;o)))
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: O'hh I'm so sorry for wingeing, when there are others on here who need more comfort than me, but I'm fed with appointment, after issue after appointment !!  Last week I saw the chemo docs -  after a long wait telling me about all the grotty side effects of FEC-T, and that I would have to have another blood test as they didn't know if I was post-menapausal or pre-menapausal then after finding out I had a hormone tipped coil in place they said 'get that out straight away', we don't want the cancer getting attracted to it. So I did that.  The nurse at my surgery said, o'h looks like you will have to have a polyp removed by day surgery, I'll let the GP know.   My tumour was ER positive, HER2 negative, attracted to hormone levels in my body.  I've already had two ops, one for a mastectomy in June and lymph node clearance in August.  Then I had to see my Manager last week about an up-date about me being off work that caused me a bit of stress, and now this coming week I have a CT scan on Wednesday and bone scan on Friday, and perhaps they'll fit in my first chemo in between !!!!  Alleluia !!!!   Forgot to fit in my wig fitting on Tuesday, but then that could be pleasant I suppose !! O'hhh God this is the first time I've shown my true feelings on this website, now I feel bad!!  Would love some comments to cheer me up !!!!   Ever emotional Winston xxx    love to all !!
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: O'hh I'm so sorry for wingeing, when there are others on here who need more comfort than me, but I'm fed with appointment, after issue after appointment !!  Last week I saw the chemo docs -  after a long wait telling me about all the grotty side effects of FEC-T, and that I would have to have another blood test as they didn't know if I was post-menapausal or pre-menapausal then after finding out I had a hormone tipped coil in place they said 'get that out straight away', we don't want the cancer getting attracted to it. Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Annabel thank you for the support and encouraging words, so lovely to here.  You know I feel so much better today !!  I do hate losing my rag, although as folks have said it is probably a good thing to release it, and let it all out.    Irene, thanks for your comments I must try some outrageous wigs tomorrow, when I go for my wig fitting, I might change my profile pic and put one of me with the new wig on it !! LOL !!   All the similarities are such a coincidence !!       Strong Willed, lovely to here from you, girly, !!!  Love the pyjama story !!  I hope your mac party goes well on the 28th September !! Emotional Winston xx :o))
Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Just a note from me, my mother also had breast cancer, at the age of 63 yrs, she took Tamoxifen in tablet form for the rest of her life and she died at the wripe old age 84 yrs of a sudden heart attack. Hope this helps.   winston xx (She didn't have problems while taking the drug.)
Posts.Title: has anyone had any possive experiences with Tamoxifen????? Am due...

Posts.Content: Well done you Strong Willed, marvellous !!  I went to the chemo unit, and had coffee and cakes and made a donation.  Met a lovely lady who had just finished her radiotherapy treatment today, who lives in Switzerland part of the year.  Had a lovely natter !  Winston xx

LOL !!!  Then I was Marilyn Monroe and I've even been Woopie Goldberg !! Ha! Ha! Love to you Irene,     Winston :o))        Thanks about the wig !!

Posts.Title: S**T !! Fed Up With The Stress Of It All !!!

Posts.Content: Please stay SASCHA ROSE !!!  I really admire that are single minded know exactly what they want, and what they don't want, your just great!   I too have to make some radical decisions about my treatment, in that I will be having more surgery than is usually had, whic is my own choice !!  Because of the fast moving nature of my cancer, after my second op on 9th August, my surgeon has said he will be strongly considering removal of second breast, (don't want cancer to jump into that one !!). But e wants to deal with immediate problem,  and that's before I even get to chemo stage pheeeeeewwww !! in for a long ride me thinks !!!!    So being single minded is great, we want you here !!!!  (I know I am relatively new to site, and there are probably a lot of women you know far more than me, but I thought I would give me opiniion.   Please PM me if you feel like it ! winston x
Posts.Title: Not sure if I still belong here or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Kiera,   My cushion that I use at home a lot, (actually I've become quite obsessional about it) in that it goes to bed every night with me, and I snuggle up to, I don't think I could sleep without it now.   A friend bought it for me from Denhelm Mill its only about 6 inches by 8 inches and I found it such a comfort just after I had my mx as I used to place it ontop of my dressing gown especially when friends, relatives came, and it helped me to get used to not having my left boob anymore, until I could get used to it not being around.  I suppose because my boobs are quite big, I had a biggish gap after my op.  Sorry, I forgot you have already been in hospital !!   It won't be long before you have your op now, the dreaded beast will soon be gone !!!!     Thanks for the hugs !!!       Lynda     "Winston" xxxxx
Posts.Title: Can't wait to have my mx operation

Posts.Content: Hi Kiera      I felt the same as you when I had my mx I realised there was this horrid tumour that had iinvaded my body and I just wanted rid of it, asap !   I also had auxillary node clearance six weeks later.   Im now half way through chemo.   The only thing I can say about energy levels is that I think they will decline gradually, (unless you are one of the lucky ones, who just sails throught it !  LOL !)  I have hit a brick wall several times over the past few weeks, when the limited trips out I have had the following day, I have landed flat on my back in quite a lot of discomfort.  The thing is you feel just great at the time, feeling you can conquer the world, but I found it was the next day I suffered.  Yuuukkkk !! Good luck with the mx, you will feel soooooooo much better when it's gone.   I wish I had taken a little cushion in with me just to rest it over the gap where my boob had once been, I have big boobs and I think I shocked a couple of patients when I got up and went to the loo, and they realised I only had one boob !!  All my prosthetics were at home !!   Just a thought.   My mobile phones and ear plugs were a great help, and a mini fan a great help as it gets soooooo hot in hospital, and if you end up on a ward where are there are a few elderly people, they just hate the cold !!   LOL !!!  Wet wipes were good too !! Contact someone if you think you have some swelling, don't suffer quietly !  Hope this helps !! Lynda  - sending love and hugs to you!!  :o))) xxx
Posts.Title: Can't wait to have my mx operation

Posts.Content: Hi Babs, I can't entirely answer your question, but by contacting your breast care nurse you are deffinately doing the right thing in my opinion.   The nurses are just great, and your nurse will be able to help you.  My BC nurse has sorted out my fears on several occasions and last week when I was beside myself with an administration issue that seemed to be getting in the way when all I wanted to do was to start my chemo, she was fantastic.    Go and see your nurse, they really are specialised girls !!!  Hope this helps.   Try not to worry too much ! Winston xxx
Posts.Title: slight small swelling under existing bust after right sided mx on...

Posts.Content: Hi Babs thats really good news about the mini break, yes, please let me know how you get on !! I hope you have a great four days away !      My mum died 8 years ago, but have really missed her lately since I got the big 'C'.  Take care Babs ! Winston xx
Posts.Title: slight small swelling under existing bust after right sided mx on...

Posts.Content: Ahhhhh  thats really good news Babs !!  Have a good old talk with her.   I can never speak so highly of these lovely ladies, they just understand !!  When I saw my BC nurse last week with my problems I put my arms out to her and cried like a baby !!  You' know before this journey I would never even let anyone see I was upset, let alone cry my eyes out, but it makes you so much better afterwards.   Even though I have now moved onto the chemo department and left surgery behind for a while, I now feel I can go to Nessie for help.       Have a good old chat with her Babs tell her how you really feel. and you will feel so much better.     I'm going up to my hospital tomorrow as in the chemo department it is the macmillan coffee morning, I know my BC nurse will be there but I feel I want to give her and the department a bit of support, and it will break the ice a bit when I go for my first chemo on Tuesday.                                  I think the diagnosis is a hard one to get used to, if we ever do.  No one really knows what we are going through really, I think the BC nurses come very very close to it, but we all have a hell of a lot of cope with.   PM me any time Babs it'll be nice to chat to you !!!         Winston xxx :o))
Posts.Title: slight small swelling under existing bust after right sided mx on...

Posts.Content: Hi Rebecca, my pal has the same breast cancer as myself, and she lives with her teenage daughter.  I know that sometimes her daughter gets a bit frustrated as mum isn't as fit as she used to be.  But at the same time my pal has parents, sisters etc.  but still has to get herself geared up for work, which she doesn't always feel like, as she has a mortgage to pay, but I know she goes in for 2/3 hrs at a time.  I email her 2/3 times a week and we are in close contact, which help both of us. You made such a strong point, that people must be out their alone. winston x
Posts.Title: Living alone

Posts.Content: Really good news.   I'm half way through chemo, and sometimes you do get  a bit weary with it all, so good news concerning the old chemo is just exstatic !!!   It really is worth it all !!   Alleluia !!! Lynda xx     "Winston"
Posts.Title: Chemo is working - yippee

Posts.Content: Hi Strong willed, glad everything went well for you ! And wow back into underwired bras!  You have given me hope girlly, my favourite bra is an underwired one, I discarded a lot of my old bras that I used to wear, but didn't have the heart to get rid of my favourite M&S one.   I collect my new boob today funny enough from my BC nurse before I g to the macmillan coffee morning, so I'm going to try it with my bra too !  Good news about the lymphodema then.    Yesterday I was excausted after all the appts. I had the day before, I practically rested all day, just getting myself sorted out for flu jab at 4pm.     Feeling better this morning !     Winston xx
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Thanks for that Kate, I do agree, its been anything but light-hearted really especially the last two weeks !!!    I think I had to laugh or I would have cried !! Winston xx
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,  I feel like putting something light-hearted on the site.  Today I had three appointments in one day, all associated with my cancer journey.   I knew the day was coming up, and actually the outcome wasn't that bad at all really !!     I left the house this morning at 9.15 pm to attend my therapy session with the oncology therapist I see about once a month, she was lovely and gave good advice, she knows I am starting chemo next week.   She is just about to go on her holidays to Venice, I did suggest that she took me with her, and if she fitted me in her suitcase I wouldn't make too much of a noise !!     I popped home quickly to pick up hubby then went onto our local hospital for my pre-chemo chat, the nurse was lovely and put me at ease immediately.  She showed me the chemo room and answered all the questions I wanted to ask.  My head was swimming afterwards the all the info she had given me.    Hubby then took me to a lovely pub/restaurant where we had a great meal and it was lovely to relax and enjoy the atmosphere.      We then drove off to another local hospital for my next appt. at 7.45pm with a gaenacologist.  It was on the cards that I was going to have a routine polyp operation at any time.    I didn't know what he was going to find ?     Thankgoodness he was happy to leave the polyp  until after my chemo had finished.   (My Chemo Consultant  had stated that if the polyp had to be removed in the eyes of the gaeny doc, it should come out after my first cycle of FEC). We drove home.   Have been out of the house on appts. more or less 11 hours !     When I got home, I sat and laughed to myself and wondered if anyone else had gone through a similar experience ?  A pretty boring day tomorrow, jut a flu jab, and its going to be administered by the nurse who first found the much talked about polyp and who suggested an operation !!   LOL !!!  (Glad today's over !!) Winston xxxx (Love and hugs to all !!) :O))
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Hi Strong willed, thanks a lot for that !  I can't believe its two weeks nearly since you started your treatment, the time has flown !  Thanks for the advice!  Hope everything goes smoothly for you with your lymphodema nurse and collecting your new prosthesis !!   I thought I would go to the chemo clinic on Friday, as they are having their own mac coffee morning , and give my support.  My breast care nurse has been lovely.     Sleep tight !!        Winston x
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Thanks for that Nain, take care !! Winston xx
Posts.Title: "On A Light-Hearted Note ........"

Posts.Content: Hi girls, hope you don't mind me joining in here.   I've just had my first Tax, had 3 Fec, but seem a lot more tired with the Tax.  Its day 4, and I'm able to walk around, then just feel like going to sleep.  Have got to see my GP tomorrow, as I think I had some sort of reaction from the Dexamethasone,  My sister-in-law said go and have a chat with someone from the chemo unit, so I don't go through this again with the next Tax.   Any comments about Tax ?   Love and hugs Lynda xx     "Winston"
Posts.Title: So why cant ibstop crying?

Posts.Content: Thank you girls for the comments, it has really helped me a lot !!  Thank you !! Lynda xx   "Winston"
Posts.Title: So why cant ibstop crying?

Posts.Content: Hi Lyn          I'm up, and awake you are obviously too, and wanted to put something down for you.  It sounds like everything has been pretty hectic for you and today may be stessful aswell.  The professionals seem to have informed you about everything that you are up against, and now they are acting swiftly with your scan and then it will be your treatment plan.  Things will then be thoroughly organised and you will then know what is happening and when it is happening, and then there will be plenty of 'action'. !!!  Breast cancer has brought us all together on this site, so we can all share the horrid ups and downs, stresses, anxieties and worries, so you ARE NOT ALONE !!  We are all in this with you every step of the way, holding your hand., and sending lots of love.  No doubt in a while I expect Sue, Sasha, Yvonne and everyone else will putting their comments on here for you, and also reassuring you.  I just couldn't pass this by without saying something to you.    Lots of Love and hugs xxxx     Lynda xxx   "Winston"
Posts.Title: Can't believe this

Posts.Content: Hi I've got to a point in my treatment, where I've decided that "I'm a person coping with cancer," and its a part of my life but it isn't going to consume all of it !!!!   Yesterday, I wasn't sure what I was going to do, husband went off to work, a quiet Sunday morning.   I phoned an elderly friend asked her if she would like me to take her out.  She was thrilled, I made it HER special day, I fussed around her, and just wanted it to be special for her.    It made my day !!   I wasn't thinking of myself, my treatment and my predicament !!!    Now I'm going to make sure I think of others just that little bit more, others might not have the big 'C', but they do sometimes need help !!    Life has to go on, the big 'C', can't take over our lives, we are all wonderful people in our own rights, cancer has touched our lives not taken it over !! Winston xxx love and hugs xx
Posts.Title: Tempting fate....ridiculous

Posts.Content: Nice one Anita !!  Anything that keeps you focussed !!  This is a great site to be on !!  I've been on this site only a couple of days, although I was diagnosed back in May of this year, five days before my birthday.   We still had a great birthday bash for hubby over local pub 2 1/2 weeks after my op. Life still goes on as normal as is possible of course ! winston  (female) xx
Posts.Title: Move in the right direction

Posts.Content: Well said Sue !!!   What a lovely post !! Speak soon, Blue Tit answered my post and sends her love to you !! Such an articulate lady !   Winston xxx
Posts.Title: 14 months later :-))

Posts.Content: Just telling you my story Nain, don't want to scare anybody !!  I had left mastectomy with 3 lymph glands + sentinel glands clear but an intramammary gland was positive.  My surgeon said he would leave it up to me if I wanted to have the lymph node clearance.  He wanted to pencil me in for the op. and if I changed my mind just let him know.   I decided to have the op. and the results were that three out of seven lymph glands were infected.  So for me it was a good choice to have the op.   I had some lymphodema for the first two weeks but it now seems to have eased off quite a bit, and I sort of think the bit of discomfort I have it still from the operation.   -  This is just my experience.  Hope all goes well for you !! winston xx
Posts.Title: Remove or Not Remove Underarm Lymph Nodes

Posts.Content: Hi Franoli        I had axilliary node clearance on 9th August, and had fluid leaking from under my arm.  Didn't feel comfortable with it really.  It did stop but I think you should get advice from your BCN about it as the other girls suggested.  All the best !!   winston xx
Posts.Title: Wound still leaking after MX
